posts.post_content:
Die {W}{U} equipment-fetching decks, die.  
  
At last, Magic will become again more about innovation and less about well-timed monetary investment.  
  
Even though I liked Stoneforge Mystic as much as I hated Jace the Pocket Sculptor, I'm glad Caw-Blade just got a headshot.
posts.html:
Die {W}{U} equipment-fetching decks, die.

At last, Magic will become again more about innovation and less about well-timed monetary investment.

Even though I liked Stoneforge Mystic as much as I hated Jace the Pocket Sculptor, I'm glad Caw-Blade just got a headshot.

posts.post_content:
This is EXACTLY what an equipment based Kor deck needed to do well.  
Now Kor decks can actually stand a chance instead of relying on lucky topdecks and having to run far too many equipments just to have a chance to draw them and wasting resources on [Armament Master](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armament Master).

Why did Wizards not learn that put into play cards should not be so cheap and efficient? See why [Elvish Piper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Piper) and [Dragon Arch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Arch) aren't banned, but [Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker) and [Aether Vial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aether Vial) are  
  
Had it not come with the top ability it would be slightly less ban worthy

posts.post_content:
Hopefully it's only a matter of time before this card receives a Legacy ban.  
  
When I go to a tournament with 84 people in it, I guess it's sort of *useful* to know that 60+ will be playing Stoneforge Mystic combos, but wasn't that exactly why Survival of the Fittest got ban-canned?  
  
EDIT: GAH!! WHY ARE YOU ALL SELLING YOUR PLAYSETS FOR UNDER $5 ON EBAY??? ??? ??? Eight of the top sixteen Legacy decks in the latest SCG Open played four Stoneforge! (That was mid-August! The ink is barely dry on their winnings announcements!)  
  
... do you all know something I don't about Stoneforge's future in Legacy?  
  
Ah heck, whatever. I intend to bid on every Stoneforge auction I can find and afford, until the Legacy hammer comes down or the price revives. Either I get a couple hundred cheap-ish copies of a bum card and arts-n-crafts them into a giant Stoneforged Banhammer artpiece after Mystic receives a legacy ban (in which case I promise to post a link to pics of it), or I recoup massive windfal... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Hey look- they printed a [Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker)-belle.   
  
(I'm kind of shocked noone else seems to have thought of that yet, lol.)  
  
But seriously, far more obviously and blatantly broken than Jace, who was merely obviously and blatantly great, but difficult to fully break with the genious way that Wizards has (up til now) executed on making the whole Planeswalker card-type inherently powerful, yet also inherently fair.  
  
Tinkerbelle, on the other hand, should have destroyed Standard right out of the gates. Her story is really a hell of a lot more like old scary cards that we look back and think 'Wizards did WHAT?!' and then we read Tournament Reports from the Era and think 'wait, it took them HOW LONG to stop calling that card crap?' Just shows that for a while there definitely was a completely valid complain of power-creep in the game, from Faeries to Jund to Valakut and that Stoneforge was, at first, 'leveling the playing field.' It almost pains to me to even think that sentence,... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

I got this card in a Worldwake fat pack. I didn't realize it saw tournament play.  
Banned along with the [Mindsculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindsculptor). I haven't really been following the Scars block though so I wouldn't know.
